title: D-Orbit ION Space Tug Hosts In-Orbit Refueling Demo
summary:
A payload launched aboard the thirteenth D-Orbit ION space tug will demonstrate key technology that will enable future in-orbit refueling systems. The thirteenth D-Orbit ION space tug, which was named Daring Diego, was launched aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rideshare mission on 1 December, carrying eight passengers and four hosted payloads. One of the hosted […]
The post D-Orbit ION Space Tug Hosts In-Orbit Refueling Demo appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: After raising $9.5 million, startup OurSky sees strong demand for space data platform
summary: Demand is strong for an online platform unveiled in early December by OurSky, a startup that raised $9.5 million to simplify tracking of objects and activities in space.

title: New Shepard return to flight slips one day
summary: Blue Origin delayed the return to flight of its New Shepard suborbital vehicle by one day as the company’s founerd says he will push the company to move more quickly on its various projects.

title: Lynk Global plans to go public to fund direct-to-smartphone satellites
summary: Lynk Global plans to list shares on Nasdaq to expand its direct-to-smartphone constellation by merging with Slam Corp, a publicly traded shell company led by former professional baseball player Alex Rodriguez.

title: Report: Hypersonic weapons challenge Pentagon tracking capabilities
summary: A new study released Dec. 18 sheds light on potential challenges in the United States' ambitious effort to deploy a network of space sensors for detecting and tracking hypersonic missiles.
